segments.text: That sink is a disaster, water everywhere like a bad joke.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's drying dishes while standing in her own flood—gross.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her clothes are going to get soaked in that dirty puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are filthy with their sneaky cookie grab.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's hand in the jar, probably leaving crumbs all over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool looks grimy, and he's climbing it without care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's reaching up, maybe touching who knows what.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water streaming down the cabinets, ruining the wood—ugh.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden's clean, unlike this mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand how careless everyone is being here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene reeks of neglect and sloppiness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those cookies will taste like trouble, covered in kitchen grime.
segments.speaker: PAR
